title: Verbally abused then turns out to be a joke
body:
Was playing hide and seek and they abused me when my partner was afk. Someone bought up the topic about being a girl gamer so I replied that being a girl gamer doesn't mean you'll be respected all the time. Was called sexist and  many male related names but I don't want to repeat it.  I was nearly brought too tears when the game ended then it turns out to be a joke. I did not laugh one bit and was very angry and pissed and since it was a hot day  that's not a good sign. All of you who think this is funny should really think about what they're doing before they type 1 letter.

P.S I forgot about the mute button btw plus I am a sensitive and emotional guy and would never be sexist to women.  {{champion:32}} {{champion:32}} {{champion:32}} {{champion:32}}

replies.body: It doesn't matter if they were joking, it's still verbal abuse. From what you've said it's pretty far from 'friendly banter' that you might come across in games.
'quality banter my dear fellow, quality banter'

> 'quality banter my dear fellow, quality banter'

Great banter right there! it truly is.

I kinda know that feel. I was in a game with three of my teammates being premade and they decided that it would be fun to call me a %%%%%%/autist/downy for the entire game. I was 0/3/0 by 15 minutes and was doing pretty bad and they were begging me to afk and uninstall. Such fun times in league. 

Ended up 5/6/13ish  and we won the game. After exiting the stats screen I found myself with four teamwork honours at the end of game -_-

Harden up princess

What was it even about? 

Going on a bit of a tangent here, I don't like the term "girl gamer". It segregates people over a superficial detail and causes conflict where it's otherwise unnecessary. It doesn't matter if you're a girl or boy in League. However, I'm not going to go out of my way to hide my gender. If that offends people that's their problem.

I'm not sure if I want to trust statistics.. but I know there are a lot of "girl gamers". You're not as unique as you think you are. It's just that different games appeal to us than males. There are some communities that are more than likely over half female, and possibly as high as 90% female players, the reverse of the League community.

I honestly would have told her to shut her mouth, if people mention that they're a girl I lose all respect for them. Because they're doing it for attention, do you see me in every match screaming that I'm a male? Nope. It reminds me of gays adding gay in gamer, get over yourself, I don't care what gender you are, if you're black or white or if you're gay or straight. There was this case of this women hitting this guys phone out of his hand, and hitting him and when he hit her back he got in trouble, when she started and he reacted, if you're gonna start %%%% finish it and don't %%%%% about sexism and women beaters when most women in the world start crap and deserve to be hit.

I am a guy gamer <3
